definitions.definition: the standard unit of money used in the UK and some other countries:
the value of the UK pound, used in comparing the values of different types of money from around the world:
examples: The devaluation of the pound will make British goods more competitive abroad.

definitions.definition: to hit or beat repeatedly with a lot of force, or to crush something by hitting it repeatedly:
examples: I could feel my heart pounding as I went on stage to collect the prize.
